definition: bamboo or wooden spear/Kangxi radical 79, occurring in 段, 毅, 殺 etc
main hall of a Buddhist temple
Hall of Supreme Harmony, the largest of the three halls that constitute the heart of the Outer Court of the Forbidden City 紫禁城[Zi3 jin4 cheng2]
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
main hall of a Buddhist temple
(literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)
court examination, the top grade imperial exam

sentences.english: Because of your temple at Jerusalem kings will bring you gifts.
sentences.chinese: 因你耶路撒冷的殿，列王必帶貢物獻給你。

sentences.english: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes?
sentences.chinese: 這稱爲我名下的殿在你們眼中豈可看爲賊窩嗎？

sentences.english: You see this is a two-storey prayer hall.
In which palace did the Emperor Wanli pass away in the Forbidden City?
sentences.chinese: 明神宗死在了紫禁城的哪個殿？

sentences.english: The temple persons aboard the palace all sent to go out, silence get startling.
sentences.chinese: 殿上的宮人都遣出去了，安靜得出奇。

sentences.english: Love can turn cottage into a golden palace .
sentences.chinese: 愛能使小屋變成黃金殿。

sentences.english: So Huram finished all the work he had undertaken for King Solomon in the temple of the Lord
sentences.chinese: 這樣，他爲所羅門王作完了耶和華殿的一切工。

sentences.english: Jotham rebuilt the Upper Gate of the temple of the Lord .
sentences.chinese: 約坦建立耶和華殿的上門。

sentences.english: So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.
sentences.chinese: 猶大就把那銀錢丟在殿裏，出去吊死了。

sentences.english: The priests who guarded the entrance put into the chest all the money that was brought to the temple of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 守門的祭司將奉到耶和華殿的一切銀子投在櫃裏。

sentences.english: Any who had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the temple of the Lord in the custody of Jehiel the Gershonite.
sentences.chinese: 凡有寶石的都交給革順人耶歇，送入耶和華殿的府庫。

sentences.english: But he spake of the temple of his body.
sentences.chinese: 但耶穌這話，是以他的身體爲殿。

sentences.english: Luckly, no major damage seems to have occurred to the House of the Moralist.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，道士殿似乎沒有大的損壞。

sentences.english: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 百姓等候撒迦利亞，詫異他許久在殿裏。

sentences.english: The old apse gave an important illusion of depth which has now been restored.
sentences.chinese: 原來那個凸顯進深的後殿如今得到了修復。

sentences.english: Inside the first hall is a 200-year-old Maitreya Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 在第一個殿裏有一尊200年曆史的彌勒佛。

definition: main hall of a Buddhist temple
main hall of a Buddhist temple
underground palace of ghouls, e.g. Asgard of Scandinavian mythology
lit. devils' castle/place occupied by sinister forces
Imperial City, inner part of Beijing, with the Forbidden City at its center
Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
